titles.title: Match Act of 2006
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a tax credit for certain entities making matching contributions to retirement plans.
Match Act of 2006

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: Match Act of 2006 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow employers and other individuals maintaining a retirement savings plan for certain low and moderate income individuals ($50,000 adjusted gross income limit for taxpayers filing joint returns) an investment tax credit for matching contributions of the first $2,000 in contributions to such plans. Sets forth rules relating to limits on matching contributions, eligibility of participating individuals, tax treatment of matching contributions, and penalties for matching contributions made on behalf of ineligible individuals.
